layman:
Sample Doctor, M.D.  
Sample Address  

RE: Sample Patient – Wife’s name: Sample Name  

Dear Sample Doctor,

Mr. Sample Patient was seen on Month DD, YYYY. He has had a vasectomy 10 years ago and a failed vasectomy reversal at the University of Michigan almost two years ago. After the surgery he has had no sperm in his semen. The surgery notes say that some sperm and sperm heads were found on the right side during the reversal. He wants to have sperm collected and frozen before his wife tries to get pregnant again. He has tried several times to make his wife ovulate, but because of an anatomical problem they have not worked. When he left the office he asked for sperm freezing. Later I was told that he only wants to do this if his wife’s ovulation is confirmed, and he may want a fresh sperm sample instead. I would like to know the final plan so we can schedule the procedure correctly. At his request, Month DD, YYYY was chosen for the sperm collection, but this may change if a fresh sample is needed. Thank you for the opportunity to see him.

Sample Doctor, M.D.
